intro: Galium austriacum var. balatonense, commonly known as Balaton bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
